page.title: 13DUNSFORD AMATEUR DRAMATIC S.
page.content: Each October brings a fresh air of excitement to Dunsford's village Hall. At a meeting of the D.A.D.S.the panto producer explains his script and the casting takes place.During the next three months rehearsals and other prepartions fill the spare time of a large number of villagers.Wednesday, music and dancing,script on other nights.Stage properties,everything from a working waterfall to a paddle- steamer that steams off the stage,are constructed by a local carpenter and his skilled helpers.Ten backcloths and many flats are designed and painted. Exquisite sound recordings are linked with superb lighting to produce an enchanting background.Front of house staff arrange for the 1500+ people who will come from far and wide to see Dunsford's Pantomime in January.
